Activity: Arrive at the office, check emails, respond to any urgent requests.
Final review of the risk management framework presentation. Ensure all materials are accurate and up-to-date.
Present the risk management framework to the CIO and COO. Clearly articulate the key elements of the framework, the results of the stress tests, and the proposed risk mitigation strategies.
Address any questions or concerns raised by the CIO and COO. Incorporate their feedback into the risk management framework and presentation materials.
Based on the feedback from the CIO and COO, revise the risk management framework document and models as necessary.
Send an email to @CIO-1 and @COO-1 summarizing the changes made to the risk management framework based on their feedback. Include the updated document and models as attachments.
Begin planning for the next week's goals and tasks. Review the project plan and identify any potential roadblocks or challenges.
Catch up on industry news and trends. Browse articles and research papers related to quantitative finance and risk management. Maybe check out some articles on Risk.net.
End of the week. Ensure all work is properly documented and organized.
